title: Stranger Things' David Harbour reveals bipolar diagnosis and 'how acting saved him'
text:

David Harbour has spoken out about his bipolar diagnosis and how he works with it, during his first appearance on a UK podcast.

The 44-year-old star of Stranger Things and Hellboy was diagnosed in his 20s and he has spoken about it on the BLANK podcast with comedian Jim Daly and author Giles Paley-Phillips.

David was candid with his insight into his life with bipolar and has said that is linked to the times in his life when his "creative energies" have taken a dip.

He said: "First of all the interesting thing about my own particular brand of it is that I never have an episode when I working.

(Image: NETFLIX)

(Image: Youtube/The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon)

"So, in some way I’ve generally been able to see a link between my own creative energies when they are channelled into some kind of work form and that when they are not channelled that it goes off into some kind of madness."

Due to him having issues when not working, David admitted that it is imperative that he is kept busy.

David continued: "In that way, it has made working even more vital to me, it’s kind of a lifeline.

(Image: Rex)

(Image: Rex)

"There are these things in society, that we very much tout, like medications and things like that, and I think they are all good.

"But there are also these intangibles, things that actually keep us alive, to me talk therapy is really important and acting."

David concluded that if it wasn't for acting, then his life may have taken a much darker turn.

He continued: "It’s important for me to be an artist, and I think if I wasn’t an artist I’d be a lot worse off and has made work more vital."
